subject: Seen in NYC
event: ... whizzing past the Flatiron Building. I've known these were coming ever since I dropped that "pedaling" clue a few posts down, but this is the first report I've received of one actually being seen on the streets. So far as I know, they are only on the streets of New York. Sorry, no, I don't know where you can find them, how many there are, or how long they will be around... but if I find out, I'll be sure to tell you here. I want to ride in one soon! [[ LATER ]] And here's the official skinny on the pedicabs. Yes, there's more than one. A whole fleet, in fact. (And a shout out here to JetboyGirl, our own resident BWB pedicabbie. Hey, Kate, how'd you like one of these?) Rides are complimentary, it says right there on the pedicabs. As to where to find them... good question. I'd look around Central Park and COlumbus Circle myself, though who knows? The first one was spotted at the Flatiron, a long way downtown, so the cabs could be popping up all over. Have fun hunting for them, guys.

comments.upictitle: Not all those who wander are lost: poppies
comments.article: That is amazing - I love it!
I want one too! How much does it cost?
oh that is awesome!
That is so awesome!

I'm thinking that adds a lot of drag to the bike. I hope the drivers are getting paid extra!

Definitely would be cool to see that whiz by on 7th Ave.
OK, that looks AMAZING.  And is probably weirding out the folks who are not familiar with the story.
That is so EPIC! I want to go to NYC now!

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: fly!
comments.article: Nice! I haven't seen one yet, but will keep my eyes peeled.
It's the Flatiron Throne!
happy happy joy joy
Wow, these HBO marketing people are really the best in the world.

comments.upictitle: ♔ Lydzi ♔ Au service du Roi Rickon.: Sunny Baudelaire
comments.article: *laughs* That's quite an amazing idea ^^.
It's not a *comfortable* ride....

I can't help being concerned for the rider's rear end. You can hurt yourself just sitting still on the Throne-- worst bicycle seat ever!

(Yeah, I know this one is just made of cardboard or something. At least I hope so.)
The new pictures looks like Union Square Park right in front of the Barnes and Noble, probably the best place to find some faithful readers!
It would be a great idea to have these at San Diego ComicCon since pedicabs are a common site there.  But you'd likely want to charge so as not to get mobbed.

I was just coming over here to comment that these would be perfect for Comic Con in SD!

(I know I'd pay extra to ride around in one, esp. if I could convince the hubby to climb back into his Ringwraith costume...)

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: fly!
comments.article:
You know she'd totally spray paint JETBOY LIVES on the sides of those things and ride around town with her aviator goggles on.

Yo K -- pick me up at my office, pls? We'll go see the Jolson story.
comments.subject: Hey, Kate, how'd you like one of these?

comments.article:
Oh, yes, I'm on my way; BwB ride for free.

I was thinking some Jetboy Lives bumper stickers might work on the back, and maybe a few others saying things like 'Jokertown or bust.' I'm sure we could come up with some interesting 'tailgating' phrases to include.
comments.subject: Re: Hey, Kate, how'd you like one of these?

comments.article: The last two pics are actually in Union Square.  Looks like they're hitting the lower part of Manhattan more than the upper. :)

I love the marketing for this show.  It really has been top notch and has been fun to watch from a perspective of always seeing it on this site or winteriscoming.  Makes me wonder what other amazing things I'm missing by not living in a big city
comments.subject: HBO

comments.article: That is awesome!!
Is it just me, or does the Iron Throne look far too cushy?  Nobody sitting on the throne should feel comfortable.  I do, however, wish these were in Denver.
comments.subject: Iron Throne Ped-Cab

comments.article: Awesome.  Must go for a ride ...but first I must visit the HBO store ...that happens this Wednesday!
So we have a murder of crows, and a fleet of thrones? ;-)

comments.upictitle: Androgynous Beauty: A Love Story: pic#0
comments.article: If I were to build one of these, would I be sued? Pedi-cabs are really common here in Chico, CA, and I think this would be an AWESOME addition! Pretty much the greatest idea ever.
comments.subject: HBO - Please don't sue...

comments.article:
Mr. Martin, I've been a fan for a long time, and I've followed your posts here on and off for several years waiting for Dance!

My problem is that I don't have HBO (I don't have television would be more accurate) and I want to watch GoT. Now I'm sure it would be possible to get my hands on it, but I want to support you, and this show.

I guess this goes out to everyone on the website here:

I live in Canada, is there any way I can watch the shows live? Or at least not have to wait until the box set to pay for them?
comments.subject: Watching GoT in Canada without HBO

comments.article: HBO Canada may have them up, since IIRC we can't watch them on the US site.
comments.subject: Re: Watching GoT in Canada without HBO
